Zoo: A place where animals are kept.
Lion: A big wild cat with a mane.
Elephant: A huge animal with a trunk.
Giraffe: An animal with a long neck.
Zebra: An animal with black and white stripes.
Hippo: A big animal that lives in water.
Rhino: A big animal with a horn on its nose.
Kangaroo: An animal that jumps and has a pouch.
Wolf: A wild animal that looks like a dog.
Camel: An animal with a hump on its back.
Parrot: A colorful bird that can copy sounds.
Cage: A place where some animals stay.
Keeper: A person who takes care of animals.
Fur: Soft hair on an animal's body.
Park: A place to play and relax.
Tree: A tall plant with a trunk.
Slide: A playground toy you slide down.
Swing: A seat that moves back and forth.
Playground: A place with games for children.
Shade: A cool area out of the sun.
Leaves: The green parts of a tree.
Grassland: A wide area covered in grass.
Fence: A barrier around a park or area.
Map: A drawing that shows where things are.
Food: Something we can eat, like pasta, chicken and rice.
Carrots: It's a vegetable, its color is orange, has green roots.
Onions: It's a round vegetable, has strong smell, has two colors.
Potatoes: It's a vegetable, has brown skin, used to make fries.
Soup: A liquid food, we drink it hot, made of mixing vegetables.
Tomato: It's a vegetable, its color is red.
Cucumber: It's a vegetable, its color is green.
Orange: It's a fruit, its color is orange, has small seeds inside.
Farmer: A man who works on a farm.
Cow: It's an animal; gives us meat, cheese and milk.
Milk: It's a liquid; its color is white; we drink it in the morning.
Market: It's a place; we go there to buy food, water and clothes.
Doctor: They help sick people, give them medicine.
Police officer: They protect us, keep us safe.
Teacher: A person who teaches us at school.
Money: We use them to buy what we need.
Water: It's liquid; we drink it a lot.
Sandwich: We can eat it; it's yummy.
Juice: A drink made from vegetables or fruit.
Cookie: It's a baked biscuit, full of chocolate.
Restaurant: It's a place, we go to eat there.
Hotel: It's a place, we can go and stay there.
Cornfield: It's a field; we can grow corn.
Orchard: It's a field; we can grow fruits.
Library: It's a place; we can read books.
Drug store: It's a place; we can buy medicine.
Bakery: It's a place; we go to buy bread and cookies.
Drum: It's round; it can be big or small; it makes loud sound.
Triangle: It's an instrument; makes soft sound; we strike it.
Strike: To hit on something using hands or sticks.
Fast: To go quickly; take short time.
Awful: Very bad; you don't like it.
Lovely: Something is good; you like it.
Dance: To move your body to music.
Sing: To make musical sounds with your voice.
Buy tickets: To give money for a card or a piece of paper.
Take picture: To use camera to take photos.
Mango: It's a fruit; we can eat it or make it juice; has a big pit inside.
Board game: It's a game played on board.
Comic book: It's a funny book, full of pictures and cartoon.
Department store: One place has many goods to buy.
